Please check in 'Vitals & Biometrics' for 'Temperature', 'Weight', 'BP', 'MUAC', 'Pulse', 'R.rate' and other parameters AND add current measurements whenever necessary

answers.label: 0: Fully active, able to carry on all pre-disease performance without restriction
1: Restricted in physically strenuous activity but ambulatory and able to carry out work of a light or sedentary nature
2: Ambulatory and capable of all self-care but unable to carry out any work activities. Up and about more than 50% of waking hours
3: Capable of only limited self-care, confined to bed or chair more than 50% of waking hours
4: Completely disabled. Cannot carry out any selfcare; totally confined to bed or chair
Heart failure (NYHA I, II, III or IV)

questions.label: Enter details and/or describe additional findings

questions.label: Description of aceto-white areas and other lesions (location, size)
Comments on lab tests and investigations

answers.label: II - Extension beyond the cervix but not to the pelvic wall or to the lower third of the vagina
III - Extension to the pelvic wall and/or involves the lower third of the vagina and/or causes hydronephrosis or a nonfunctioning kidney
IV - Extension beyond the true pelvis or has clinically involved the mucosa of the bladder and/or rectum
IA -  Invasive cancer identified only microscopically. Invasion is limited to measured stromal invasion with a maximum depth of 5 mm and no wider than 7 mm
IB - confined to the cervix or preclinical lesions greater than Stage IA
IIIA - No extension into the pelvic sidewall but involvement of the lower third of the vagina
IIIB - Extension into the pelvic sidewall or hydronephrosis or non-functioning kidney
IVA - Spread of the tumour into adjacent pelvic organs
IA1 - Measured invasion of the stroma <3mm in depth and <7mm diameter width
IA2 - Measured invasion of stroma <3mm but <5mm in depth and <7mm diameter width
